pr_title: KOGITO-2427: Milestones panel on process details page

timeline.message: KOGITO-2427: Milestones panel on process details page

timeline.bodyText: not sure - maybe whitespace format? before '{'
timeline.author: jstastny-cz

timeline.bodyText: statuses here are undefined, thus there are no labels for the milestones below.
timeline.author: jstastny-cz
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,285 @@
+// Jest Snapshot v1, https://goo.gl/fbAQLP
+
+exports[`Process details page milestones panel Snapshot test with default props 1`] = `
+<ProcessDetailsMilestones
+  milestones={
+    Array [
+      Object {
+        "__typename": "Milestones",
+        "id": "27107f38-d888-4edf-9a4f-11b9e6d75m36",
+        "name": "Milestone 1: Order placed",
+        "status": undefined,

timeline.bodyText: in graphql types.tsx I can see just available, active, completed. Terminated is not there.
timeline.author: jstastny-cz

replies.bodyText: Terminated will be added in types.tsx. @nmirasch wdyt?
replies.author: Sara4994

replies.bodyText: @Sara4994, @jstastny-cz  yes that was my fault on the jira description I have added that terminated status. But now is confirmed https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2427?focusedCommentId=14417836&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-14417836 we have available, active, completed status.
replies.author: nmirasch

timeline.bodyText: I guess the comparison is based on the order in which values are defined in MilestoneStatus type?
timeline.author: jstastny-cz

timeline.bodyText: the status values are probably not passed correctly, see the snapshot, it results in undefined, thus there's no value returned by handleStatus function.
timeline.author: jstastny-cz
jstastny-cz
